datafield.subfield: Letter, 1672 April 22, England to the Comte d'Estr√©es concerning the combined fleets of France and England in war against Holland :
Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use.
Accompanied by an English translation and a portrait (colored engraving).

MS 3327, Container 77: Bookplate of William H. and Miriam Lutcher Stark. The leaf and three additions are matted and housed in a pamphlet style binding covered in quarter blue cloth probably British 19th or 20th c. The documents are housed in single-sided mats and one is housed in a double-sided mat. These four support boards are made into two gatherings ; they are connected using a cloth hinge. They are sewn into a pamphlet structure with a butterfly stitch. The item is housed in a blue cloth portfolio with flaps and a leather fore-edge closure. The telescoping box is in navy blue goatskin, head, tail, covers, and foredge tooled with single gilt fillet. The box has an air hole at the top. Spine has 5 false raised bands and is titled and tooled in a gilt floralmotif. Box is lined with a dark blue cloth. The portfolio is in light blue cloth with a wave moiree pattern. It has a label on skiver. The pastedowns are light blue wove paper. The documents are held in place with three cloth flaps.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
